movement.description: Defines how the speed calculations are performed on this Particle.

type.description: The particles move freely, like normal particles, not bound to anything.

speed.description: The initial speed of the particle, in pixels per second.

acceleration.description: The acceleration rate of the particle, in pixels per second.

type.description: Almost same as above, except the initial speed is multiplied by the particle offset relative to the emitter, at least `-spawnScale` and at most `spawnScale`.

speed.description: The initial speed of the particle, in pixels per second.

acceleration.description: The acceleration rate of the particle, in pixels per second.

type.description: The particles are moving along a circle. The `speed` and `acceleration` fields become numbers.

speed.description: The initial speed of the particle, in radians per second.

acceleration.description: The acceleration rate of the particle, in radians per second.

spawnScale.description: The particle will be spawned at a random angle on an ellipse of these perihellium and aphellium.

lifespan.description: How many seconds the particle should exist. If left out, it will persist indefinitely.

sprite.description: Path to the Sprite which should represent this Particle.

animationFrameCount.description: How many frames are in the animation.

animationSpeed.description: Speed of the animation, in frames per second.

animationLoop.description: If set, the animation will loop. Otherwise, it will stop on the last frame.

animationFrameRandom.description: If set, the initial animation frame will be picked at random from all possible frames. Otherwise, it will always start from the first frame.

fadeTime.description: Can be only set if lifespan is not specified. This is the time that will be used for fadeInPoint and fadeOutPoint calculation, while the particle itself can still exist indefinitely.
fadeTime.markdownDescription: Can be only set if `lifespan` is not specified. This is the time that will be used for `fadeInPoint` and `fadeOutPoint` calculation, while the particle itself can still exist indefinitely.

fadeInPoint.description: Percentage of the particle's lifespan (or fadeTime if lifespan is not defined), until which the particle's alpha will be linearly interpolated from 0 to 1.

fadeOutPoint.description: Percentage of the particle's lifespan (or fadeTime if lifespan is not defined), from which the particle's alpha will be linearly decreasing from 1 to 0.

posRelative.description: If set, the particle will move along with its spawner.

colorPalette.description: Path to the Color Palette, if the particle will be tinted.

colorPaletteSpeed.description: The speed of the Color Palette animation, in pixels per second.

directionDeviationTime.description: The delay before directional deviation kicks in.

directionDeviationSpeed.description: The speed of directional deviation, in radians per second. This will rotate the particle's speed vector.

angle.description: The starting rotation of this Particle, in radians.

angleSpeed.description: The rotation speed of this Particle, in radians per second.
